There is an undirected graph G with n vertices and m edges. Every time, you can select several edges and delete them. The edges selected must meet the following condition: let Gâ€² be graph induced from these edges, then every connected component of Gâ€² has at most one cycle. The first line contains two integers n and m (1â‰¤nâ‰¤2000,0â‰¤mâ‰¤2000) -- the number of vertices and the number of edges.
For the next m lines, each line contains two integers ui and vi, which means there is an undirected edge between ui and vi (1â‰¤ui,viâ‰¤n,uiâ‰ vi).
The sum of values of n in all test cases doesn't exceed 2â‹…104. The sum of values of m in all test cases doesn't exceed 2â‹…104.
Output
For each test case, output the minimum number of deletion needed.
